data.title: Fast and tasty
data.text: Had a dinner there before a show and there were lots of choices of toppings, a friendly staff, and fast service. The crust is good and the toppings were,. too. Saw that they feature locally brewed beers.

data.title: Very Disappointing
data.text: I was excited to try this pizza as the reviews online and the bragging of my Ball State friends would lead me to believe that eating this pizza was going to be a religious experience. Maybe the pizza tastes better if you are slightly intoxicated as I found the pizza to be a disaster with the sauce slightly interesting but the rest of the pizza very poor. The breadsticks were very overpriced and nothing special. The salad we ordered was six bucks for some lettuce in a styrofoam container. I won't be going back as there are plenty of decent pizza options in town.

data.title: Visit the location in The Village of West Clay
data.text:
Those who grew up in Muncie, Indiana usually argue about who has the better pizza: Greeks or Pizza King. The fact of the matter is that both are good, for different reasons.

We were so thrilled when Greeks decided to open a restaurant within walking distance of our home. Greeks is known for their thick, chewy crust and a sauce that just explodes in your mouth. And, of course, your favorite toppings make for a perfect pizza experience.

This location has limited seating indoors and outside but, interestingly, you can get a pizza "to go" and take it across the street to the craft pub and order a microbrew to enjoy with your pizza (or salad or breadsticks...all are available on the menu).

We have two pizza restaurants in our neighborhood, with very different styles and which I crave on different occasions. Greeks is your traditional pizza place but so far ahead of a chain that it's palpable.

For newbies: Gaze at the portrait photo of a young man advertising Greek's pizza and try to figure out who it is. The answer will surprise you...

A great place to take the family.

data.title: BEST pizza ever!
data.text: The first time I ever had greeks was in Muncie, and I've been hooked ever since! My husband agrees this is the best pizza we've  ever had. The sauce is somewhat sweet, and the crust is buttery and delicious. The breadsticks are to die for.

data.title: Best pizza we have had so far
data.text: We have only recently moved to Carmel but Greeks has become our go to pizza place.  Our fav is the Greeks special and the kids adore the cheese sticks.  We had friends in town last weekend and they tried it and said it was the best pizza they ever had!!  Great delivery service too which is free!

data.title: Welcome to West Clay!
data.text: Just had our first of many trips to Greeks. Friendly servers, very good pizza and a room full of people are good indicators for their future success. The place has a good feel to it. Glad they're open!

data.title: Not gourmet but very tasty!
data.text: I personally like thick crust pizza and this is what Greek's serves. Surprisingly, the crust is not too greasy which is hard to find in the "fuller-figured" crust category. We had the extra-large pizza and breadsticks (Saturday special) and I thought it was great. Compared to papa johns, dominos, and similar sorts, this was far better!

data.title: Excited when they came to town
data.text: I've long been a fan of the Greek's franchise, since I grew up in the same town it started.  We have been several times and everything is really good, thicker crust pizza that I love.  Good value and good toppings, would recommend to anyone looking for a nice casual place to dine in, carry out, or have delivery.

data.title: Undercooked and Low Quality!
data.text:
My family and I tried Greek's Pizza Carmel last weekend. We ordered a sausage pizza and order of breadsticks.  The pizza was horribly undercooked, cheese barely melted and crust not crispy at all.  The sausage was very low quality, I pulled it off and through it away.  I would say there pizza is the same quality as Papa Johns but double the price.  The breadsticks were pretty good.  I thought it odd that $4 for 5 breadsticks and they didn't include sauce, be it cheese or marinara and charged an extra .78 for sauce.  

While I waited for my pizza which was not ready in the 20 minutes they told me on the phone, I heard 3 people come to counter and complain that either their food or drinks were taking too long.  I think they were either short staffed or busy, although there weren't many people in the restaurant at all.  I got our pizza to go so I can't speak directly about the service.

I would definitely not recommend Greeks or go there again.  Go to Some Guys or Bazbaeux and get good pizza for the same price.

data.title: Muito boa a Pizza ....piperone  Bom D ++++++++
data.text: Pizza muito boa e a de piperone é muito boa a massa chocante e fina ,vale a pena ........e Carmel no verão está toda florida e um cenário lindooooooooo .
